name: heliotrope
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a plant with sweet-smelling purple or blue flowers: Heliotropes sweetly scented the air. You can take cuttings of heliotrope and fuschias.
silentstock639/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ U ] a light purple colour: Beside the fire sat Aunt Emily, dressed in heliotrope. We admire the shades of purple, blue and heliotrope in the crystals.
golubovy/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe soil is packed with flowers including heliotropes, which have purple blossoms that smell like vanilla.Her garden had roses and heliotrope, myrtle, and a little orange tree in it.She designs opulent gowns in shades of heliotrope and jade. The lights grew stronger, deep purple bleeding into heliotrope, claret, salmon, coral.
